runs.comm: short of length ball on the pads, clipped towards midwicket
back of length ball just outside off, blocked to the off side
Amla is off the mark by guiding this from off stump towards third man
pushed back towards the bowler
length ball on off stump, lashed towards point where Williamson fields
short of length once more, 129kph, keeping it around off, carved towards extra cover or a single, a quiet start to the game
starts with one well outside off, mistimed stroke from de Kock sends the ball past the bowler for a single
short of length ball is edged down to third man where Corey Anderson has to get around quickly
pitched up on off stump, a crisp drive towards mid-off, no run for that though
short of length ball is swiped by Amla in front of square leg for four, not the most eye-catching of strokes from a man who usually deals in silken shots
length ball angling across outside off, defended from the crease
gets forward and defends this towards point
short of length ball slanting across, de Kock whips that towards midwicket from well outside off
on middle stump, Amla moves across the stumps before the ball is bowled and then clips the ball towards deep square leg
full length on middle and leg, clipped towards midwicket, where he is put down by Guptill, an early reprieve for Amla
eased towards mid-on for a single
a wild slog from de Kock as he looks to thrash a ball past point, plenty of bounce there for Mills, too much for de Kock
de Kock going for another wild cross-batted stroke, this time he gets closer to the ball than on the previous delivery, but only close enough to get a thin edge through to the keeper
short of length and on off stump, shuffles across and clips this behind square
just outside off, Amla guides it down towards third man for a single, it is a shot he uses to great effect in ODIs
pitched up and driven towards cover

Faf gets going with a big shot over mid-off, doesn't connect as well as he would have liked after skipping down the track, Southee has to dive face first as he pulls that in inches from the rope, has he hurt his hamstring in that effort?
crashed towards point but that's a dot ball
again Amla playing an unusual shot, looking to loft through cover, not the sort of stroke you expect to see him play, he misses this outside-off delivery
extra bounce there, Faf is surprised by that Southee delivery, Faf takes the bottom hand off the bat as he keeps that out, off the outside edge towards point
shorter ball outside off, and Faf tries a complete slog after dancing down the track, nowhere near the ball, what's going on with the SA batting here?
goes for another big hit, doesn't quite time it and it goes high over midwicket and lands safely
Faf has decided he is going to go for it early on, shuffles across the stumps and plays a sort of scoop shot to send the ball to the fine-leg boundary

another lofted hit from Faf, clear intention to get the run-rate high early on, he takes a couple of paces down the pitch and launches this towards deep extra cover though he doesn't quite get to the pitch, clears Anderson and gets four more

Faf's frenetic innings is over, eight all-action deliveries is all he lasted in the middle, not sure he tried to play even one of those deliveries along the ground, this is a slower ball, well outside off, Faf chips it straight to cover and Southee has a wicket, despite all the big hits attempts SA are only 32 for 2 in five overs
once again Amla steers the ball past slip towards third man
pitched up and outside off, 141kph, pushed towards mid-off for a quick run
AB can't time it as he looks to drive towards mid-off
a touch shorter , on middle stump, again not too well timed as he taps the ball towards midwicket
there's the AB we know, gets some width and he carves that through the covers for four, too much width there
length ball on off stump, defended towards cover to end the over
a leading edge as Amla looks to work the ball towards midwicket, the ball rolls towards point
driven to mid-off for a single
full ball on the pads, another drive for a single, this time to long-on

and here's the big one! New Zealand on top here as AB is gone, he falls over after playing that stroke, he backs well away from the stumps and loses his balance as he looks to crash the ball through covers, the ball takes leg stump, New Zealand are jubilant
full ball is driven back towards the bowler
short of length ball on leg stump, Duminy works it towards point
just outside off, Duminy waits for the ball to arrive and steers it towards third man for a single
full ball and Amla, who has shuffled across the stumps, that nearly sneaks under the bat as Amla looks to get it towards midwicket, low on the bat as it trickles towards fine leg
whipped towards deep midwicket for a single
short ball on leg stump, pulled away towards deep backward square leg
slanting in towards off stump, full ball, Amla walks across the stumps and tucks that towards fine leg
full ball is worked towards midwicket, a wristy stroke from Amla, B McCullum dives to his right to cut that off, a good bit of fielding that
eased towards mid-on for a single
that was too short, should have been put away, Amla knows it, he wanted to thump that to square leg but misses out
full ball just outside off, this time Amla gets a boundary, but not where he intends it, goes for the booming drive and gets a thick outside edge, down to third man for four
another leading edge from Amla. sends the ball towards mid-off
a drive all along the ground to long-on for an easy single
short of length ball on off stump, Corey Anderson's first ball is blocked down the track
clipped past midwicket for a single, Duminy not attempting anything fancy early in his innings
from round the wicket, length ball at 115kph, outside off and that is helped along to third man for a single
short of length ball just outside off, another one that is guided towards third man, an area that has been productive for SA today
length ball on off stump, driven towards cover
short of length ball well outside off, Amla walks across the stumps and tucks the ball towards midwicket
comes don the track and chips this over mid-on for a single
full ball well outside off, jammed towards mid-off for a single
towards mid-off for a single
swatted away towards deep midwicket, where some superb fielding from Munro and Williamson prevents the boundary, first the dive from Munro to keep it in
thumped towards cover but not wide of the fielder
Duminy decides to go for the scoop, trying to play it over the keeper's head, doesn't connect and the ball sails over the stumps
goes for a slog towards midwicket this time, and doesn't get anywhere near the ball
full and well wide of off stump, McClenagahan is not happy that is called a wide
Duminy looks for the lofted hit, can't time it properly, but gets enough to clear mid-on, not enough to get a boundary
this time Duminy gets it right in the middle, a short of length ball outside off is hammered over midwicket for six, Duminy had walked across the stumps to get close to the line of the ball
shuffles across and whips this towards deep square leg
a full ball outside off, Amla also wants to move across the stumps and wants to tuck the ball to the leg side, can't connect
a full toss is thumped towards long-off for a single
towards midwicket for one more, McCullum's impressive spell continues
Amla shuffles down the track, McCullum fires it on the pads, clipped behind square leg
Amla goes for the big swipe, bottom edge sends the ball to short fine leg
full ball on the pads, worked towards deep midwicket
well outside off, crunched towards wide long-on for two
full ball well outside off, squeezed towards sweeper cover
Duminy seemed to have an eternity to change his stroke, he bent his knees and was in position to play the ramp, he seems cramped, but he sends this past the keeper and towards fine third man for four
length ball is dispatched over the leg side, over square leg for six, SA finally getting the acceleration they want

that is a bizarre way to go, terribly unlucky for Amla, he swatted that one powerfully back towards the bowler, the ball hits the non-striker Duminy's bat, on the shoulder of the bat and loops up for a simple catch for Anderson, Amla has to go, the umpire had turned away to get out of the way, Anderson keeps his focus and plucks that one
short of length ball outside off, carved towards point for a single
can't get bat on it as the ball angles away outside off
length ball on off stump, worked towards midwicket by Miller
drives this one towards long-off for a single, think about a second but there isn't time
short of length is slapped towards point
length ball is driven towards long-off for a single to bring up SA's hundred
giving Williamson an over is a gamble, and he's under pressure after the first ball as Duminy launches it towards deep extra cover for four
a single towards mid-on
slapped to sweeper cover for a single
worked towards the vacant mid-on for two, the bowler Williamson had to chase after that, giving the batsmen time to take the second
JP showing off his range of strokes here, the reverse-sweep this time, bisects the men near backward point
works it towards square leg for a single
Duminy pulls this one away to the square-leg boundary to reach his half-century, taken him only 31 deliveries
Duminy walking across the stumps on most deliveries, this is a slower one from Southee, full and well outside off, squeezed towards cover
full and very wide, Duminy again moves across the stumps, has to still reach out for that one, gets there and gets enough power on the drive to beat sweeper cover
Duminy on fire here, another four - the third of the over - gets on one knee after shuffling across the stumps, sort of sweep behind square leg
slower one from round the wicket, length ball is drilled towards long-on

great effort from Guptill to cut that off but he can't, it was very wide from Southee, Miller takes the bottom hand off the bat as he slaps that behind point, still gets enough power to beat a diving Guptill, who gets a hand on in but can't prevent the ball from rolling onto the rope
length ball is whipped somewhat awkwardly towards square leg for a single

how many catches for Anderson in this tournament? he gets another one, another caught-and-bowled, Miller is gone for 6 after chipping the ball back towards the bowler, it was a slower one from Anderson, Miller looked to play it cross-batted, can't time it at all, easy catch
length ball is clipped towards deep square leg, terrific throw from Guptill there but can't prevent the second
short of length ball outside off, driven towards cover
power from Albie, length ball is clubbed over cover for six, had the room to free his arms, connects superbly with the ball, and that clears the rope comfortably
length ball on middle and leg, a wristy stroke sends the ball towards deep midwicket
full toss well outside off, swiped towards midwicket
a low full toss outside off, squeezed out towards sweeper cover
length ball well outside off, another heave, can't time it and the ball doesn't have much pace on it as it heads towards deep midwicket
low full toss, way outside off once more, thumped down the ground for four, plenty of power from Duminy

Duminy goes for the sweep, it results in a top edge, but luckily for him there's no one at deep square leg, Southee gives it his best to prevent the ball from reaching the rope, his dive is to no avail though
six more, Duminy in top form here, a full toss is dismissed from his presence, clobbered over long-on for a big six, top T20 innings from Duminy
slower short ball, Albie shows his power, as he thumps this towards wide long-on, a diving stop from Anderson, who seemed to start his chase late

slower one once more from Southee, 122kph, Albie looks to hammer it towards midwicket, his cross-batted attempt doesn't connect with the middle of the bat, just a bottom edge onto the top of middle stump
full toss outside off, Steyn does the smart thing by taking a single and giving Duminy the strike, Dteyn pushes this towards long-on

Aleem Dar was fearing for his life for a moment there, Duminy unleashes a fearsome straight hit to a low full toss, Dar shows off his reflexes by going down to ground quickly, over his head and for four
short and down the leg side, would have been a wide if he let that go, Duminy swings it down to fine leg for four more
chips this over the bowler, Steyn is out of the blocks early and they have time to take the second, South Africa finish on 170
